intro: Micranthes clavistaminea, commonly known as the clustered pipsissewa, is a small evergreen shrub native to the northern United States and southern Canada. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and dense foliage. The plant features narrow, dark green leaves that are arranged in clusters along the stems, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white or pale pink, typically blooming in late spring. The plant is often found in moist, acidic soils in woodlands and along stream banks.
